text: hi everyone Anthony fan tanto here
the Internet's busiest music nerd and
it's time for you review 2 Chainz based

rapper this is his full-length official
label released debut and it is pretty
much comprised of a group of songs that
cover all the bases from southern hip
hop to gangsta rap pop rap and trap rap
as well now this guy has been making
waves with some pretty big features
lately he is rapped on tracks with Drake
and Big KRIT kanye he had a verse on a
Justin Bieber track too recently I
believe but that's just lately the dude
is easily done over a hundred features
on on albums and mixtapes over the years
two chains has essentially made it by
being everywhere just kind of saturating
the southern market with his verses he
also has a good ear for just very trunk
knocking beats and a knack for rapping
kind of ear worm hooks a dude with those
qualities is going to make money and a

just see dollar signs so that is pretty
much all I had for the backdrop on this

over here ah cow um why is his name tool
chains he doesn't have three um no I'm
sure he has more than the two chains uh
from what I understand he had to kind of
change his name from something else also
he said his name was one chain no no the
name was a titty boy
that's a bad name to Chiang overall I'm
based on a true story you're pretty much
not going to get anything you're not

listened to a few popular hip-hip-hip a
pop albums of the southern style and I

approaches is unique a guy like Rick
Ross definitely has the more glamorous

Waka Flocka can do the dirty trap thing
much more authentically if I have to
kind of pigeon-holed 2 Chainz into
anything he just kind of puts out a lot

narcissistic anecdotes with a much less
distinct voice he knows that his verses
are dumber than rocks and I feel like he
knows that because he never really tries
to make anything he says all too
meaningful or deep or emotional which
can really ruin an album if you actually
don't have anything significant to say
now I do you think hip hop of this style
and 2 Chainz in general can be
entertaining especially with his
ridiculous delivery the occasional
stumble in his flow or just sound effect
with his mouth and of course his
punchlines which can be so bad and so
corny sometimes that becomes hilarious
what 2 Chainz does lyrically on this
album is is pretty basic it's it's
pretty shallow I mean if you're
listening to this thing and really
analyzing his lyrics and and pulling
them apart for deeper meanings you
really got to reassess some priorities
because this is nothing more than the
hip hop that is more about the beat than
it is the emcee it's more about the
repetitious hook than it is about a real
statement it's more about the
shortsighted lyrical jabs than it is
about anything long term or quotable and
as long as we're talking quotes I've
quoted some of what I think are the
worst lines on this album down there in
the D box so yeah I know that being
ultra lyrical isn't the point
2 Chainz album I get the joke my problem
is that the joke gets old it gets so old
so fast 2 Chainz could easily be swapped
out with any number of rappers that are
spinning about the same kind of crap app
don't act like we don't already
understand that the mainstream rap game
is pretty much just a revolving door of
hip-hop artists who get hot and then
cool off after making one or two albums
some find a niche and grow others don't
and I don't really see 2 Chainz finding
his niche on this thing it starts off
with a really underwhelming just boring
intro with little Wayne the B is just
too flowery to really kick anything off
the tracks 2 through 5 with with no lie
and then birthday song and crack are all
bangers just really catchy really just
impactful some of the best songs on the
album I thought despite the lyrical you
know badness the album cools down with
the track different over this beat that
kind of reminds me of something that the

in the day but you know 2 Chainz lyrics
were kind of ridiculous over the song
and the fact that beat was cooler made

no-no after that comes a slow jam then I

Nicki Minaj's verse on that track
terrible I don't know what's worse not

getting it and actually thinking it's

there's a nice soulful instrumental that

as this LP draws on all the better

kind of old just like the joke I get
kind of weary of hearing
all these rattling high hats these

between chromatic intervals throughout
the track
I said chromatic intervals it gets older
than dirt and the thing is if you're at
all familiar with 2chainz career I think
it's going to get pretty annoying
hearing him trying to put out one track
